verses.verse: And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> spake <S%H1696><s%> unto Moses <S%H4872><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>,

Speak <S%H1696><s%> unto the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, and say <S%H559><s%> unto them, When a man <S%H376><s%> shall make a singular <S%H6381><s%> vow <S%H5088><s%>, the persons <S%H5315><s%> shall be for the LORD <S%H3068><s%> by thy estimation <S%H6187><s%>.

And thy estimation <S%H6187><s%> shall be of the male <S%H2145><s%> from twenty <S%H6242><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> even unto sixty <S%H8346><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%>, even thy estimation <S%H6187><s%> shall be fifty <S%H2572><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%>, after the shekel <S%H8255><s%> of the sanctuary <S%H6944><s%>.
And if it be a female <S%H5347><s%>, then thy estimation <S%H6187><s%> shall be thirty <S%H7970><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%>.

And if it be from five <S%H2568><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> even unto twenty <S%H6242><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%>, then thy estimation <S%H6187><s%> shall be of the male <S%H2145><s%> twenty <S%H6242><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%>, and for the female <S%H5347><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%>.

And if it be from a month <S%H2320><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> even unto five <S%H2568><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%>, then thy estimation <S%H6187><s%> shall be of the male <S%H2145><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%>, and for the female <S%H5347><s%> thy estimation <S%H6187><s%> shall be three <S%H7969><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%>.

And if it be from sixty <S%H8346><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> and above <S%H4605><s%>; if it be a male <S%H2145><s%>, then thy estimation <S%H6187><s%> shall be fifteen <S%H2568><s%> <S%H6240><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%>, and for the female <S%H5347><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%>.

But if he be poorer <S%H4134><s%> than thy estimation <S%H6187><s%>, then he shall present <S%H5975><s%> himself before <S%H6440><s%> the priest <S%H3548><s%>, and the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall value <S%H6186><s%> him; according to <S%H6310><s%> his ability <S%H3027><s%> <S%H5381><s%> that vowed <S%H5087><s%> shall the priest <S%H3548><s%> value <S%H6186><s%> him.

And if it be a beast <S%H929><s%>, whereof men bring <S%H7126><s%> an offering <S%H7133><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, all that any man giveth <S%H5414><s%> of such unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%> shall be holy <S%H6944><s%>.

He shall not alter <S%H2498><s%> it, nor change <S%H4171><s%> it, a good <S%H2896><s%> for a bad <S%H7451><s%>, or a bad <S%H7451><s%> for a good <S%H2896><s%>: and if he shall at all <S%H4171><s%> change <S%H4171><s%> beast <S%H929><s%> for beast <S%H929><s%>, then it and the exchange <S%H8545><s%> thereof shall be holy <S%H6944><s%>.

And if it be any unclean <S%H2931><s%> beast <S%H929><s%>, of which they do not offer <S%H7126><s%> a sacrifice <S%H7133><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, then he shall present <S%H5975><s%> the beast <S%H929><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the priest <S%H3548><s%>:

And the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall value <S%H6186><s%> it, whether <S%H996><s%> it be good <S%H2896><s%> or <S%H996><s%> bad <S%H7451><s%>: as thou valuest <S%H6187><s%> it, who art the priest <S%H3548><s%>, so shall it be. as: Heb. according to thy estimation, O priest, etc
But if he will at all <S%H1350><s%> redeem <S%H1350><s%> it, then he shall add <S%H3254><s%> a fifth <S%H2549><s%> part thereof unto thy estimation <S%H6187><s%>.

And when a man <S%H376><s%> shall sanctify <S%H6942><s%> his house <S%H1004><s%> to be holy <S%H6944><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, then the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall estimate <S%H6186><s%> it, whether it be good <S%H2896><s%> or bad <S%H7451><s%>: as the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall estimate <S%H6186><s%> it, so shall it stand <S%H6965><s%>.

And if he that sanctified <S%H6942><s%> it will redeem <S%H1350><s%> his house <S%H1004><s%>, then he shall add <S%H3254><s%> the fifth <S%H2549><s%> part of the money <S%H3701><s%> of thy estimation <S%H6187><s%> unto it, and it shall be his.

And if a man <S%H376><s%> shall sanctify <S%H6942><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%> some part of a field <S%H7704><s%> of his possession <S%H272><s%>, then thy estimation <S%H6187><s%> shall be according <S%H6310><s%> to the seed <S%H2233><s%> thereof: an homer <S%H2563><s%> of barley <S%H8184><s%> seed <S%H2233><s%> shall be valued at fifty <S%H2572><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%>. an: or, the land of an homer, etc
If he sanctify <S%H6942><s%> his field <S%H7704><s%> from the year <S%H8141><s%> of jubile <S%H3104><s%>, according to thy estimation <S%H6187><s%> it shall stand <S%H6965><s%>.

But if he sanctify <S%H6942><s%> his field <S%H7704><s%> after <S%H310><s%> the jubile <S%H3104><s%>, then the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall reckon <S%H2803><s%> unto him the money <S%H3701><s%> according to <S%H6310><s%> the years <S%H8141><s%> that remain <S%H3498><s%>, even unto the year <S%H8141><s%> of the jubile <S%H3104><s%>, and it shall be abated <S%H1639><s%> from thy estimation <S%H6187><s%>.

And if he that sanctified <S%H6942><s%> the field <S%H7704><s%> will in any wise <S%H1350><s%> redeem <S%H1350><s%> it, then he shall add <S%H3254><s%> the fifth <S%H2549><s%> part of the money <S%H3701><s%> of thy estimation <S%H6187><s%> unto it, and it shall be assured <S%H6965><s%> to him.

And if he will not redeem <S%H1350><s%> the field <S%H7704><s%>, or if he have sold <S%H4376><s%> the field <S%H7704><s%> to another <S%H312><s%> man <S%H376><s%>, it shall not be redeemed <S%H1350><s%> any more.

But the field <S%H7704><s%>, when it goeth out <S%H3318><s%> in the jubile <S%H3104><s%>, shall be holy <S%H6944><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, as a field <S%H7704><s%> devoted <S%H2764><s%>; the possession <S%H272><s%> thereof shall be the priest's <S%H3548><s%>.
And if a man sanctify <S%H6942><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%> a field <S%H7704><s%> which he hath bought <S%H4736><s%>, which is not of the fields <S%H7704><s%> of his possession <S%H272><s%>;

Then the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall reckon <S%H2803><s%> unto him the worth <S%H4373><s%> of thy estimation <S%H6187><s%>, even unto the year <S%H8141><s%> of the jubile <S%H3104><s%>: and he shall give <S%H5414><s%> thine estimation <S%H6187><s%> in that day <S%H3117><s%>, as a holy thing <S%H6944><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.

In the year <S%H8141><s%> of the jubile <S%H3104><s%> the field <S%H7704><s%> shall return <S%H7725><s%> unto him of whom it was bought <S%H7069><s%>, even to him to whom the possession <S%H272><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> did belong.
And all thy estimations <S%H6187><s%> shall be according to the shekel <S%H8255><s%> of the sanctuary <S%H6944><s%>: twenty <S%H6242><s%> gerahs <S%H1626><s%> shall be the shekel <S%H8255><s%>.

Only the firstling <S%H1060><s%> of the beasts <S%H929><s%>, which should be the LORD'S <S%H3068><s%> firstling <S%H1069><s%>, no man <S%H376><s%> shall sanctify <S%H6942><s%> it; whether it be ox <S%H7794><s%>, or sheep <S%H7716><s%>: it is the LORD'S <S%H3068><s%>. firstling of: Heb. firstborn, etc

And if it be of an unclean <S%H2931><s%> beast <S%H929><s%>, then he shall redeem <S%H6299><s%> it according to thine estimation <S%H6187><s%>, and shall add <S%H3254><s%> a fifth <S%H2549><s%> part of it thereto: or if it be not redeemed <S%H1350><s%>, then it shall be sold <S%H4376><s%> according to thy estimation <S%H6187><s%>.

Notwithstanding no devoted thing <S%H2764><s%>, that a man <S%H376><s%> shall devote <S%H2763><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%> of all that he hath, both of man <S%H120><s%> and beast <S%H929><s%>, and of the field <S%H7704><s%> of his possession <S%H272><s%>, shall be sold <S%H4376><s%> or redeemed <S%H1350><s%>: every devoted thing <S%H2764><s%> is most <S%H6944><s%> holy <S%H6944><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.
None devoted <S%H2764><s%>, which shall be <S%H3808><s%> devoted <S%H2763><s%> of men <S%H120><s%>, shall be redeemed <S%H6299><s%>; but shall surely <S%H4191><s%> be put to death <S%H4191><s%>.

And all the tithe <S%H4643><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%>, whether of the seed <S%H2233><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%>, or of the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of the tree <S%H6086><s%>, is the LORD'S <S%H3068><s%>: it is holy <S%H6944><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.
And if a man <S%H376><s%> will at all <S%H1350><s%> redeem <S%H1350><s%> ought of his tithes <S%H4643><s%>, he shall add <S%H3254><s%> thereto the fifth <S%H2549><s%> part thereof.

And concerning the tithe <S%H4643><s%> of the herd <S%H1241><s%>, or of the flock <S%H6629><s%>, even of whatsoever passeth <S%H5674><s%> under the rod <S%H7626><s%>, the tenth <S%H6224><s%> shall be holy <S%H6944><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.

He shall not search <S%H1239><s%> whether it be good <S%H2896><s%> or bad <S%H7451><s%>, neither shall he change <S%H4171><s%> it: and if he change <S%H4171><s%> it at all <S%H4171><s%>, then both it and the change <S%H8545><s%> thereof shall be holy <S%H6944><s%>; it shall not be redeemed <S%H1350><s%>.

These are the commandments <S%H4687><s%>, which the LORD <S%H3068><s%> commanded <S%H6680><s%> Moses <S%H4872><s%> for the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> in mount <S%H2022><s%> Sinai <S%H5514><s%>.
